results.title: Joy
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Rachel Clements and Cate Shortland
results.brief_description:
Thursday night. Late night shopping. Joy wants to have fun. This film follows a teenage girl as she hits the town in search of a good time. But Joy’s search for fulfillment leaves her lost and lonely at the end of the evening as we follow her to her unhappy home. By the director of ‘Somersault’ (2004). Original format 35mm/colour.
WARNING: This film contains scenes that may offend some viewers.

results.title: Intransit
results.creator_credit: Isabel Perez, Mike Daly and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
A boy journeys into his own dark underworld where he is confronted by the vengeful father of his imagination.
Features Louis Westgarth as Ben, James Hagen as Ben’s father and Humphrey Westgarth as young Ben.

results.title: Into the night
results.creator_credit: Rachel Clements, Melissa Johnston, Tony Krawitz and AFTRS
results.brief_description: A lost and fragile boy new to the streets. A wary teenager just thinking about the money. A wealthy man playing out a delicate and lonely game. Over one night their lives intersect in unexpected ways, blurring the line between betrayer and betrayed.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rachel Clements, Melissa Johnston, Tony Krawitz and AFTRS

results.title: Binary
results.creator_credit: Rachel Roberts, Mike Daly and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
Trapped in a cell of fear, Claire’s longing for connection propels her beyond the known world.
The world of Binary is neither a particular time or place, it is Claire’s headspace. The images, sounds and content of the film always represent Claire’s mental state, they are completely subjective. Digital visual effects were employed in the production of Binary to assist this approach and to portray Claire’s increasingly unstable view of her world.
Features Susan Prior as Claire and Briden Aspinall as the young girl.

results.title: Universal Appliance Co.
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Michaeley O'Brien, Ruth Kleinhenz and Andrew Lancaster
results.brief_description: 1. An inventor finally gets a chance to mass produce his latest creation at the Universal Appliance Company factory. The production line runs smoothly until advertising and romance become distractions. Another multi-award winning production for director and sound designer Andrew Lancaster.

results.title: That's showbiz
results.brief_description: A hilarious comedy which details the rise and fall of a failing outback vaudeville troupe which imports an infamous city striptease, Madame Lash, to enliven their act.

results.title: Strange residues
results.creator_credit: Fetus Ferguson, Norman Neeson, Alexander Proyas and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
When a strange batch of unlabelled records start arriving in record shops, customers are drawn irresistably to them. But when played, they cause weird dreams which turn the dreamers into zombies. What are these records? Are they the work of alien beings from another planet, using dreams to manipulate mankind? What is the true story?
A reporter examines this unusual situation.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Fetus Ferguson, Norman Neeson, Alexander Proyas and AFTRS

results.title: The Rentman
results.creator_credit: Peter Flynn, Ross Hutchens and AFTRS
results.brief_description: A rent collector for the Housing Commission (low cost public housing) calls on one of his tenants, an elderly Aboriginal woman, for their regular cup of tea together. In the past he has protected her against the bureaucracy of the state housing system, but this visit is different.

In the past he has protected her against the bureaucracy of the state housing system, but this visit is different.

results.title: Odd jobs
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Andrew Ryan, Jonathon Green and Daniel Nettheim
results.brief_description: Two Boy Scouts, intent on earning money by doing odd jobs, stumble upon a spooky old house and its macabre owner. He looks forward to scaring them with his “house of horrors” - but young boys today aren’t so easily frightened.
results.creator_credit_for_label: AFTRS, Andrew Ryan, Jonathon Green and Daniel Nettheim
